name: Homewood Suites New Orleans

reviews.text: We charged our room but paid for parking in cash. Front desk gave us a receipt that we paid in cash. After arriving home we saw our charge card was billed for parking. Wonder who put that $20.00 in their pocket? Unfortunately somewhere along the trip home the reciept saying we paid cash for parking was misplaced.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel Just Double Check Receipts

reviews.text: Other than that the hotel was very nice & other services were great. The rooms were beautiful.
reviews.title: Excellent location- great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in an excellent location on a quiet side of New Orleans. Only a 10 min walk to the French Quarter. Easy walking distance from the RiverWalk, Casino, Aquarium, Canal Street. We stayed there for 4 days and walked everywhere. They offer a light meal on late afternoons with beer and wine and that was nice. Nothing gourmet, but fruits and salad was fresh and the children enjoyed it. Our schedule was busy and we could only enjoy this meal once but is nice to have it. The place was clean and breakfast was the usual (although they ran out of coffe almost every morning and had to wait for new brewed pot), fresh fruit also with breakfast was nice (not the fruitfrom a jar) and the staff was very nice and helpful.
reviews.title: great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Homewood Suites in February after Mardi Gras was over. The hotel was in a great location, we were able to walk to the busy area of the French Quarter. The hotel is in a quieter location. One night we went down to Frenchman street and it was easy to get a cab back to the hotel.
reviews.title: Stay here if you hate yourself

reviews.text: The staff at the hotel were excellent. Everyone was very pleasant. Checking in was easy and they let us know that parking on the street was available on the weekends, saving us the parking fee. The rooms were very clean and breakfast was included,although th breakfast is somewhat simple it met our needs.
reviews.title: Great location & value

reviews.text: I stay at Homewood suites nationwide and they vary greatly with several factors going into the equation. If you happen to be on an extended stay in downtown New Orleans you can't go wrong with this hotel. But if your stay is less than 1 work week there are more options you may want to consider.
reviews.title: Nice Homewood but not one of the best

reviews.text: Don't get me wrong. This is a nice place. But there are other national hotels that are closer to The Quarter and Bourbon street. Dining, pubs, shops etc are about a 5 block walk away from this hotel. Other than a coffee shop, and a couple of food places there's not much around.
reviews.title: Perfect suites, perfect location, perfect staff

reviews.text: The rooms are nice. The kitchen area is basically part of the living space. There's no island, bar or counter connected to it. But you can eat at the desk table or the coffee table in front of the sofa. The bedroom is good sized with a king bed that is comfortable. The bathroom is spacious although the tub is somewhat narrow. The rooms have a walk out balcony that is kind of nice but other buildings obstruct most decent views. The TVs are conventional 27inch types. The Internet service is adequate. The term "high speed" is quickly becoming over used by hotels.
reviews.title: Family Like environment

reviews.text: Breakfast and the night time meals are good.
reviews.title: Not up to Hilton Standards

reviews.text: The hotel is 12th floors high and that's where I stayed. The water pressure in the shower was very weak. I ended up changing rooms lower because of this. if you are typically a top floor person be aware.
reviews.title: Essence Music Festival - Stay

reviews.text: I travel a lot for work and stayed at this hotel for several weeks. The front desk service is the absolute worst I have ever seen in a hotel. Please, send those kids on some hospitality training. I was afraid to ask them anything because they never knew or could never help.. or try to help. I got several pieces of mail and was never once notified that a piece had arrived... so it could sit for days or weeks without someone lifting a finger. I asked the front desk for extra hangers in June and I'm still waiting. My co-worker had his room charged to someone else's credit card for two weeks in a row, and the front desk still hasn't realized something went wrong. (He only noticed after he checked out and is contacting Hilton management about the error.)
reviews.title: Very good and very bad in one place
Smoking Room!
reviews.text: On the flip side, however, I stayed as long as I did because of the better-than-expected breakfasts and dinners. Not magnificent, but pretty good for a complimentary service. I especially liked the assortment of fresh fruit with every meal. And unlike the front desk, the kitchen staff new about good service. Thank goodness.

The suites were spacious, the beds were comfortable. The electrical sockets didn't all work. The water was gone for an entire weekend and Monday morning while I was there. The building is not the newest or best maintained, but I wouldn't say it was dirty or falling apart. I do understand some previous comments about smokey non-smoking rooms because I've smelt smoke coming from non-smoking rooms several times. (7th floor is supposed to be the smoking floor.)
reviews.title: Nice 6 day stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other amenities: there is complimentary wireless (and wired) internet service, a computer room with 2 or 3 computers, a gym with 2 or 3 older treadmills and dumb bells, and a guest laundry room with 3 washers and 4 dryers.
reviews.title: Room was a little depressing

reviews.text: I booked a non-smoking room (months and months in advance) and got a smoking room. The room really reeked and even the "Ozone Treatment' they did to the room did not help. There seemed to be a lot of people living at this hotel for a very extended amount of time. If I had it to do over, I would have booked at the Hampton Inn. It's a little closer to the French Quarter, right on the trolley line and has lots of stuff near it.
reviews.title: A Nice Stay

reviews.text: The positives: An excellent downtown location for business travelers and just fine for leisure travel, just a 10-minute walk to the French Quarter and the Riverfront. A very pretty indoor pool and whirlpool. Spacious rooms (and you can't beat those 2BR suites when traveling with kids!).
reviews.title: Spacious downtown hotel but starting to show its age.

reviews.text: Homewood suites were clean comfortable and very accommodating. The rates were reasonable . The kitchen had a breakfast buffet every morning and every evening light buffet was available. People were wonderful and gave us suggestions of places to see. This was my first trip to New Orleans and will not be my last. It was great fun and I felt safe.
reviews.title: comfortable beds, excellent service, friendly employees

reviews.text: Let me start by saying that this was my first time ever in New Orleans, so I didn't know exactly what to expect of the city or its hotels. I was pleasantly surprised to find the Homewood right in downtown - it seems like they're usually only at the airport or in the suburbs.
reviews.title: Class-A Hotel but find somewhere else to park.

reviews.text: The hotel is very nice and very clean, and the staff is very helpful. We used points and were still upgraded to a 2-bedroom 2-bath suite. The hotel is rather new I would guess, as nothing seemed stained or worn out. Breakfast was great, always waffles, grains, cereals and juices + more hot food daily, one day was scrambled eggs with ham, and bacon; anither day was plain eggs and pancakes.
reviews.title: Homewood Suites-nice and roomy

likes.liked: — The large room with separate living area and the free breakfast
likes.disliked: — wish it were closer to the Quarter

reviews.text: Overall this hotel is a great choice but I have two complaints:
reviews.title: This place was great!

reviews.text: A short walk to Bourbon St., clean, great service and a fabulous free continental breakfast (eggs, waffles, sausage, biscuits plus all the usual other stuff)- can't beat it! Only complaint was that the wiireless internet was pokey slow- had to plug in.
reviews.title: Fantastic location, great value

reviews.text: I found Homewood Suites to be clean and comfortabe. I stayed in a one bedroom suite on the 11th floor. The room was spacious with a full kitchen complete with dishes and silverware, towels, etc. There was a pull-out sofa in the living room as well. I was pleasantly surprised by how quiet the room was. I barely ever heard any noise from the hallway or adjoining rooms. There is also a laundry room onsite for hotel guests. The staff was always very friendly and courteous. The hotel is walking distance to the French Quarter.
reviews.title: Great hotel....unless you have a car

reviews.text: I only have two complaints:
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: (1) Maintenance problems - the first few days I was there, I had a problem with the toilet. I called the front desk to request maintenance. The desk clerk informed me that there wasn't a maintenance person onsite but that housekeeping would bring a plunger for me to use. No one ever brought a plunger. I ended up fixing the problem myself.
reviews.title: parking lot dangerous for guests, lousy gym

reviews.text: There's good and bad about this hotel.
reviews.title: A second review from your extended stay business traveler

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good:
reviews.title: Hotel needs update/improvement, but good location

reviews.text: 1. Location
reviews.title: Feels like home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. Very good breakfast and hosted evening meals
reviews.title: The greatest hotel and manager

reviews.text: The bad:
reviews.title: elegant, comfortable, central to everything!

aka: Homewood Suites New Orleans Hotel New Orleans
